page.title: 14The Elderly In Felixstowe
page.content: In Old Felixstowe there is a development of{Sheltered Housing}in Gosford Way. Thirty six people live here. It is owned and run by the Council. The elderly who live here are single and cater for themselves. They have the security of knowing that by ringing an alarm bell, someone will come to help them. The warden is fairly young and able to cope with all their needs. Also there are many{private {residential homes}for the elderly in Felixstowe. The sea air is bracing and there are many large Victorian houses which provide suitable accommodation. A typical home is the Foxgrove in Old Felixstowe. Twenty three people live here and the oldest is ninety five. A room with a bath costs Â£145 per week.
